intro: Achyrophorus boissierianus, commonly known as the Boissier's spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Achyrophorus boissierianus is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
